title: Food Preparation in Biological Contaminated Areas
brief: How to safely prepare local food sources when biological contamination is present.
steps: Step 1: Use only as last resort - sealed combat rations and processed food in containers are safer.
Step 2: Select only healthy-looking plants and animals. Avoid known vector carriers like rats.
Step 3: Always wear gloves and protective clothing when handling any local food sources.
Step 4: Prepare plants using same methods as for radioactive areas (wash, peel, scrub).
Step 5: Cook all food by boiling only - boil for at least 10 minutes to kill all pathogens.
Step 6: Never fry, bake, or roast local food - no guarantee all portions reach killing temperature.
warnings: No guarantee that cooking kills all biological agents
Use local food only in life or death situations
You can survive longer without food than you can survive eating contaminated food
Never eat any raw food in biological contamination areas
